title: South Live: Friday 26 January - BBC News
summary: man pleads not guilty to banbury murders .
portsmouth hospitals nhs trust forecasts £ 37m deficit .
river stour body believed to be jean lea .
reversing car crashes into maidenhead hairdressers .

documents.title: murder probe after injured man dies
text: murder probe after injured man dies

text: mp accuses nhs trust of 'cover up '

documents.title: have a good weekend !
text: thank you for clicking on bbc south live today .
we 'll be back with the latest headlines , sports news and travel updates from across the region at 08:00 gmt on monday .
until then you can get in touch with us on facebook by using our oxford , hampshire , dorset , and berkshire pages or via our twitter accounts : @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: bird poo blamed for tree-felling
text: bird poo blamed for tree-felling

documents.title: woman cleared of controlling prostitutes
text: woman cleared of controlling prostitutes

documents.title: oxford sinkhole repaired
text: a sinkhole which opened up in the centre of oxford has been repaired .
it was found on broad street close to the grade i listed sheldonian theatre early on tuesday .
the hole was about 30cm wide on the surface but stretched for about a metre in either direction below
thames water worked with oxfordshire county council 's archaeologist on the `` complex repair '' , which was completed this afternoon allowing broad street to reopen .

documents.title: husband and wife among crash dead
text: husband and wife among crash dead

documents.title: jane austen letter to go on display
text: a letter written by novelist jane austen to her niece is to go on display in hampshire as part of an exhibition .
the manuscript letter was written on 13 march 1816 at austen 's home in chawton , which is now jane austen 's house museum .
it will form part of the museum 's family , friendship and northanger abbey display for four months from 1 february 2018 .
the letter shows jane `` characteristically darting from one subject to another '' , the museum said .
`` she begins with a discussion of literature before offering caroline news of visitors , family members and the 'sad ' march weather . ''

documents.title: searches in farnborough after suspected murder
text: police investigating a suspected murder in farnborough have been carrying searches around mayfield road this afternoon .
they were called to the street at about 13:45 gmt after an injured man was found .
he was later pronounced dead and two men have been arrested .
hampshire police says it does n't believe it 's spoke `` to all those involved in the incident '' .
searches and investigations into the exact circumstances of the man 's death continue , the force added .

documents.title: frank lampard denies u 's manager reports
text: frank lampard says he 's not had any recent discussions with oxford united about vacant manager 's job .
the club is searching for a new boss following pep clotet 's departure on monday and the former england midfielder has been linked with the position .

but he has been telling radio station talksport that the speculation is wide of the mark - although he did admit to meeting with director dave jones to discuss the job before pep clotet was appointed in the summer .

documents.title: woman cleared of prostitution charges
text: a woman who was arrested in a police anti-slavery operation has been found not guilty of controlling prostitutes .
sorina ursa , 23 , was among four people detained in raids on a business and three homes in portsmouth on 22 august .
three `` vulnerable women '' were identified and sex equipment was found in the raids , police said previously .
ms ursa , of beecham road , was cleared by a jury at portsmouth crown court of two counts of controlling prostitution for gain .

documents.title: map reveals 'british maritime empire ' trading routes
text: historians at the university of southampton have mapped the trading routes of medieval shipping which helped `` sow the seeds of the british maritime empire '' .
more than 50,000 ship movements from 600 ports around england , wales and the channel islands , dating between 1400 and 1580 have been compiled for the interactive map and database .
researchers found most shipping at the time was done between local ports rather than going abroad with traders opting for ships rather than using the country 's mud-track roads .

they also found that , as well as familiar ports still in use such as southampton , falmouth , cardiff and liverpool , a large number of smaller coastal and river towns were once bustling ports , including bewdley on the river severn in worcestershire , which has 200 voyages logged in the database .

at the start of the late medieval and tudor period , english shippers were mainly coastal traders , but by the end , [ sir francis ] drake had set out on his voyage of circumnavigation and walter raleigh was close to planting england 's first settlers on roanoke island in north america . ''

documents.title: breakingman found dead in farnborough
text: police have launched a murder investigation following the death of a man in farnborough .
officers found an injured man at mayfield road in the town at about 13:45 gmt .
he was pronounced dead at the scene , hampshire police said .
two people have been arrested .

documents.title: reversing car crashes into hairdressers
text: reversing car crashes into hairdressers

documents.title: oxford hospital trust 'disappointed ' with mp 's remarks
text: dame fiona caldicott , chairman of oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust , has responded to claims made by victoria prentis about its transparency .
she said : `` we were disappointed to hear victoria prentis ' comments and we do not recognise her description of oxford university hospitals as an organisation with a 'culture of secrecy ' .
`` we strive to be as open and transparent as possible with our patients , governors , local communities and mps .
`` our board meetings are held in public with papers published on our website in advance .
`` patients , the public and staff are elected onto our council of governors , which has a key role to play in ensuring we always listen to the voices of the people who we are here to serve .
`` we always aim to reply promptly to questions and issues raised about our services , including those from members of parliament .

`` sometimes it may take us a little longer to reply to letters and emails raising concerns so that we can establish the true facts before responding to them , but we always aim to reply as promptly as possible .
`` senior staff in the trust are also always willing to talk on the phone in urgent situations . ''

documents.title: police name lasham crash victims
text: the names of three people who died in crash in lasham on saturday have been released by police .
heidi eyre , 77 , and her husband patrick eyre , 80 , who were both from london , died after the honda they were travelling in collided with a hyundai on the a339 .
robert beresford , 90 , from alton , who was also in the car , died early on 21 january in hospital .
the driver of the honda , who is 87 , and the people travelling in the hyundai suffered minor injuries .

documents.title: banbury mp : 'culture of secrecy ' at oxford hospitals
text: an oxfordshire mp has told bbc radio oxford that she 's worried there 's a `` culture of secrecy '' at oxford 's hospitals when services reach crisis point .
victoria prentis , the conservative mp for north oxfordshire , made the comments during a discussion on a shortage of midwives in the county .
she said : `` i 'm very worried that there is a culture of secrecy because of the furore over the horton midwife unit being downgraded , and i 'm worried we 're not being told the truth . ''
she added : `` i wrote to the trust in a civil manner [ about the churchill hospital ] asking for details .
`` i did want to probe because we are worried , very worried , about recruitment of medical staff in oxfordshire .
i have n't had a reply .
`` i am concerned that instead of being open and honest and transparent with us the hospital just tries to cover things up . ''

documents.title: woman assaulted in homophobic attack
text: a woman has been assaulted by a group of five women in a homophobic attack in alton .
police say it happened between 12:30 and 01:30 on sunday morning .
the 25-year-old victim was subjected to homophobic abuse and left with bruises and scratches to her face .
officers have asked any witnesses to contact them on 101 .

documents.title: west way land sale completed
text: the redevelopment of the west way shopping precinct in botley has taken a step forward .
the land has been sold by vale of white horse district council to botley development company for £ 12.4m .
the authority reduced the price by about £ 1.4m to help developers make changes to their plans to meet the needs of the community .
planning permission for the project was granted in 2016 , despite almost 350 residents raising objections .
the council said the developers intended to start work `` as soon as possible '' .

documents.title: aldershot sign mcdonnell and mcquoid
text: aldershot sign mcdonnell and mcquoid

documents.title: 'autism university ' opens after revamp
text: 'autism university ' opens after revamp

documents.title: high street shoplifter jailed
text: prolific shoplifter who stole more than £ 1000 of goods from high street shops is jailed

documents.title: record signing is 'exciting attacking option '
text: southampton fc 's new striker guido carrillo , who has signed for a club-record £ 19m fee , is a `` very exciting attacking option '' , the club has said .
the 26-year-old argentine has scored five goals in 22 appearances for monaco this season .
saints boss mauricio pellegrino previously worked with carrillo at argentine club estudiantes .

documents.title: river stour body believed to be jean lea
text: a body found in a dorset river is believed to be that of missing woman jean lea and not of a man also missing in the area , police have said .
police said on monday remains discovered in the river stour at iford were thought to be missing 70-year-old andrew latcham from blandford .
both mr latcham 's and ms lea 's families have been updated on the development .
the force said 67-year-old ms lea , from bournemouth , had been missing since 26 march .
her death has been referred to the coroner .
mr latcham , who has dementia , disappeared from his home in park road , blandford , on 30 december .

documents.title: firm pays woman 's asbestos-caused cancer treatment costs
text: a woman with cancer caused by asbestos exposure is having life-saving private treatment in what has been called a `` first-of-its-kind '' settlement .
pamela stubberfield , 74 , said `` she would n't be here '' without the drugs paid for by ex-employer boc .
she was exposed to asbestos in her job in the early-1960s and diagnosed with mesothelioma in 2016 .
the cancer can take decades to develop , but kills about 90 % of patients within five years of diagnosis .
mrs stubberfield , from wantage , oxfordshire , was working as a laboratory technician for boc for three weeks after leaving school when she came into contact with asbestos .
`` i just knew that i had been exposed but i thought it had been a fairly brief period and that i had been lucky '' , mrs stubberfield said .
author: Marcus Liddell
BBC South

documents.title: mother jailed for stealing £ 60,000 from business
text: a mother from abingdon has been jailed for 14 months after she stole more than £ 60,000 from a family-run business .
victoria bailie , 37 , oversaw the finances of abingdon stone and marble in 2014 and began stealing money paid in by customers in september 2014 .
she stole about £ 5,000 every month over a one-year period , the court heard .
bailie 's defence said she took the money to support her daughter and young children from a previous relationship in south africa .
judge ian pringle qc said bailie 's job was one of huge responsibility and a level of trust which she abused .
author: Matt Graveling
BBC South Today Oxford

documents.title: paper moves to colour after 90 years
text: the first colour edition of a local hampshire newspaper has gone on sale .
the weekly broadsheet lymington times and new milton advertiser ( a & t ) has been published in black and white for almost 90 years .
the independent publication which covers the new forest and christchurch has previously been produced on a converted printer which is run by a john dere tractor engine
the new smaller colour version of the paper will be produced on high-speed presses in portsmouth owned by johnston press .

documents.title: call to speed up helicopter inquiry
text: call to speed up helicopter inquiry

documents.title: reading university student accommodation plans revised
text: plans for housing hundreds more students in flats in reading have been revised again after concerns from local people .
the university of reading says it 's removed the sixth storey from both accommodation buildings at the centre of the st patrick 's hall redevelopment .
a final decision is expected to be made in february .
author: Sam Clayton
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

documents.title: man arrested after crash kills coach driver
text: a man has been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving after a crash in oxfordshire which killed a coach driver .
it involved a luton van and a coach on the b480 just after the coach and horses public house on the b480 near stadhampton at about 16:00 yesterday .
the coach driver , a 62-year-old man from cholsey , was treated by paramedics but died at the scene .
the driver of the van , a 58-year-old man from stokenchurch , was uninjured .
he was arrested and has since been released under investigation .
thames valley police is appealing for witnesses to come forward .

documents.title: call to speed up inquiry into 2013 shetland helicopter crash that killed winchester man
text: an msp is calling for a fatal accident inquiry into a helicopter crash which killed four people in 2013 to be held as soon as possible .
a total of 18 people were on board when the super puma crashed on its approach to sumburgh .
sarah darnley , from elgin , gary mccrossan , from inverness , duncan munro , from bishop auckland , and george allison , from winchester , died .
shetland msp tavish scott has lodged a holyrood motion about the fai .

documents.title: meon valley mp : portsmouth hospital finances 'truly shocking '
text: george hollingbery , the conservative mp for meon valley , has described the state of the finances at portsmouth hospitals nhs trust as `` truly shocking '' .
the queen alexandra hospital in portsmouth has revealed it is £ 37m in the red .

mr hollingbery said : `` i welcome the fact that the new management team has been so open about the scale of overspending and that they are clear in their intentions to protect patients , services and staff as they take action to deal with the problem .
`` but we all need to know more .
the aspiration is admirable but the task is formidable . ''

he said he would be meeting with health secretary jeremy hunt to `` ask him for assurances that local people can have confidence that the problem is recognised at the highest level and that it will be dealt with '' .

documents.title: man pleads not guilty to banbury murders
text: a man has pleaded not guilty to the murder of two men in banbury .
adrian fannon , 39 , and mark pawley , 25 , died from `` multiple stab wounds '' at a flat in newland road in october .
raymond morgan , 52 , of newland road , has been charged with two counts of murder .
appearing from hm prison bullingdon via a video link at oxford crown court , he pleaded not guilty .
the trial will be on 5 march .

documents.title: hampshire pcc 'had trouble creating close working relationship ' with deputy
text: hampshire police and crime commissioner michael lane has been explaining the departure of his deputy flick drummond ( the former conservative mp for portsmouth south .
he told the hampshire and iow police and crime panel that her departure had been a mutual decision .
mr lane said there needed to be a close relationship between the commissioner and the deputy but `` it could not happen in this case '' .
he said it was a disappointment to them both that they would need to separate .
mrs drummond was formally confirmed in the £ 64,000-a-year post in october but left weeks later .
at the time she said : `` sometimes it is not possible to build a professional relationship between two people , through no fault of either party . ''

documents.title: close shave after car reverses into hairdresser
text: a hairdresser in maidenhead received what police called an `` unscheduled appointment '' when a car reversed and smashed into the front of the shop yesterday .
finishing touch salon co-owner albert harris said it was `` an absolute disaster '' when he arrived last night .
however , it was `` business as usual '' today after he and staff `` knuckled down '' to clear up all the mess and board up the front .
he said : `` obviously it 's not a very pretty sight but at least we 're working and keeping the clients happy . ''

documents.title: portsmouth hospitals nhs trust forecasts £ 37m deficit
text: an nhs trust has forecast a considerable end-of-year deficit , despite previously agreeing to make `` vast '' savings .
portsmouth hospitals nhs trust admitted its `` financial engagement '' was `` not strong '' and forecast a £ 37m deficit for the year ending in march .
it said it could not deliver the savings , and a £ 10m surplus , it had agreed with regulator nhs improvement .
the deficit will not affect services or involve redundancies , it said .
chief executive mark cubbon ( who joined in july , said there had been a `` culture across the trust in which finances have not been prioritised '' .

documents.title: cyclist injured in crash with police car
text: cyclist injured in crash with police car

documents.title: man hit by bus in critical condition
text: man hit by bus in critical condition

documents.title: isle of wight seriously ill patients 'to be moved to mainland '
text: seriously ill patients could be transferred from the isle of wight to the mainland under new proposals .
the plans for st mary 's hospital , newport , would ease the pressure it faces by cutting the number of operations by 8,000 a year , the island 's nhs trust has said .
however , there are concerns some of the most vulnerable patients could be put at risk during lengthy transfers .
the trust said the move would improve quality of care for patients .

documents.title: paulton 's park zookeeper reads to porcupines
text: a zookeeper has been reading children 's books to two young porcupines , to prepare them for their first public appearance .
the porcupines , dill and pickle , are brothers and moved to paulton 's park , near romsey , hampshire , last month , ahead of the opening of a new `` little africa '' attraction .
louise taylor reads to the animals every day for about 20 minutes .

documents.title: body found believed to be missing woman
text: body found believed to be missing woman

documents.title: 'stuck ' lorry blocks traffic in poole
text: lorry 'stuck ' on bournemouth road in parkstone .
picture from @ twitterid

documents.title: oxford city council selects new leader
text: the new leader of oxford city council has been elected .
councillor susan brown will take over from councillor bob price when he stands down at the end of the month , ahead of his retirement in may .
susan brown has been a councillor for 17 years and is the current deputy leader of the ruling labour group .
she said : `` it is an honour and a privilege to be elected as leader of my group and the council .
`` it is very exciting to be able to play my part in developing the vision for oxford 's future - the city where i grew up and have spent most of my life .
`` bob is a very hard act to follow as he has been carrying out the role for 12 years now and has brought great experience and wisdom to the role . ''

documents.title: weather : 'largely dry and bright '
text: friday is expected to be largely dry and bright across the region , with the odd bit of sunshine breaking through the clouds and a high of 8°c .
author: Alex Osborne
BBC Weather

documents.title: man hit by bus in reading taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries
text: a man has been taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries after he was hit by a bus in reading .
it happened on bath road at about 18:00 yesterday .
south central ambulance said they treated a man at the scene before he was taken to the john radcliffe hospital .
author: Sam Clayton
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

documents.title: man arrested following portsmouth crash
text: a man has been arrested following a collision in portsmouth this morning which involved a police vehicle , a white ford focus and a cyclist .
a hampshire constabulary spokeswoman said it happened at the junction of bradford road and victoria road north at about 00:20 .
she added : `` the cyclist was taken to southampton general hospital with leg and spinal injuries .
`` bradford road and victoria road north from the junction with winston churchill avenue and st david 's road are closed .
`` a 24-year-old man from middlesex has been arrested on sus of drink driving and causing serious injury by dangerous driving . ''
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to bbc south live .
we will bring you the latest headlines from across the region along with sport , travel and weather updates until 18:00 .
you can get in touch with us using our oxford , hampshire , dorset , and berkshire facebook pages , or via our twitter accounts : @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
